hanzi-su-wiki:
央

Значения

Центр, середина; глава

Мнемоника

  • Большой 大 человек в центре 中 походного шатра.

  • "Этот герой — центральная фигура в этом кино."

heisig_chinese_memo: You've got the St. Bernard dead center in your sights (the box).
heisig_constituent: center, large, St. Bernard, box body
heisig_story: The elements depict a St. Bernard with its head and paws keeping their stick-like form, but with the middle or center of its body filled out in a box-like shape.
koohiiStory1: Youve got the st bernard dead centre in your sights (the box).
koohiiStory2: The center of a dog´s universe is his mouth: bark, eat, bite. What a life! RTK2:　オウ　中央　ちゅうおう(center)…　　　　　　　　　　　　　Semi-Pure Group　(ｴｲ): 英1741　 映1742.
jp_example_words: 中央(ちゅうおう): center, middle, central
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: If someone has a big head you have to try to focus on the center of it when you talk to them.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: You don't want to get caught with your eyes wandering all over their big head. Stare right at the center of their face. Ah geez, their eyes are kinda far away from here. You can really only see their nose...
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: This is the center of the 王's (おう) head so you have to be extra careful not to look anywhere else.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: The 王 will definitely cut off your normal-sized head if he sees you looking all over his big head and not at the center.
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ノ, 冖 (ва), 大 (большой)
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: You've got the St. Bernard dead center in your sights (the box).
origin_of_ch_char_book: The King connects Heaven and Earth. The trinity of Heaven, Earth and Human is also reflected in the character which means king: (王, wang, king). The three horizontal lines mean sky, human and earth, and the vertical line means the connection of the three elements each other. So this word is interpreted as the person who connects heaven and earth, the holy king. On the other hand, I think this character depicts a big man () wearing something like a flat hat (), who is standing on a flat platform () and with his arms and legs spread widely, ordering others. Ancient East Asian civilizations were discovered in the North Eastern area of China. Sculptures of ancient kings (or Shamans) unearthed at these archaeological sites show that they wore headdresses which were flat. The meaning of the flat shape could be to show that this person is “ a big man who can connect Heaven and Earth and Human.” In ancient China, the king thought to himself as the center of the world. (央, yang, middle) consists of the king 大 (da, big), and the H-shaped symbol that means from border to border. Putting these symbols together, we can see the symbol means the king who reigns over the whole land. This king had a variety of decorations on his head to show he was something special.
humanum_full_description_en:
Jia Jin inscription from " big " or " tian " (like a human figure on the front) from ◎, like a person wearing a shackle on the neck, is the original word for disaster (Ding Shan). "Shuowen": "Sorry, blame."

It is said that when a person wears a shackle, his head is in the center, so the extension implies the center (Xu Zhongshu). Gao Hongjin believes that ◎ looks like a pole. People must stand in the middle of the pole when carrying a pole, so it means central. "Said Wen": "Yang, the central government. From the big to the inside. The big, the people. The Yang and the side agrees. It's a long time."

Oracle is used as a person's name. In addition to being used as a person's name, the inscription also expresses a distinctive appearance. White Plate of Guo Jizi: "Tong Shi Qi Yang", "Poetry. Xiaoya. "June": "Weaving Bird Chapter, Bai Yang Yang Yang." Mao Heng "Biography": "Yang Yang, bright appearance."

The script " Yang " in the silk and bamboo slips pretends to be " Hang ", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type": "None of this can be killed, Xiaoyang (殃), Dayang (殃)." "Mawangdui Han Silk Book. "Ancient Lost Book before the First Book of Lao Zi": "If you go wrong, the sky will fall to the center."
humanum_short_description_en: Inscriptions from " big " or " heaven " (like the front of a human figure) from ◎, like the shape of a person wearing a shackle on the neck, is the original word for " sorrow " (Ding Shan). "Shuowen": "Sorry, blame."
humanum_full_description:
甲金文從「大」或「天」(象人形正面)從◎，象人頸部戴枷鎖之形，是災殃的「殃」的本字(丁山)。《說文》：「殃，咎也。」

　　一說人戴枷鎖時頭在中央，故引申有中央之意(徐中舒)。高鴻縉則認為◎象扁擔之形，人挑擔時必站在扁擔中央，故有中央之意。《說文》：「央，中央也。从大在冂之内。大，人也。央旁同意。一曰久也。」

　　甲骨文用作人名。金文除用作人名外，還表示鮮明之貌。虢季子白盤：「彤矢其央」，《詩．小雅．六月》：「織文鳥章，白旆央央。」毛亨《傳》：「央央，鮮明貌。」

　　簡帛文字「央」通假作「殃」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》：「此皆不可殺，小殺小央(殃)，大殺大央(殃)。」《馬王堆漢帛書．老子乙本卷前古佚書》：「過極失當，天將降央(殃)。」《說文》：「殃，咎也。一曰禍也、罰也、敗也。」
humanum_short_description: 甲金文從「大」或「天」(象人形正面)從◎，象人頸部戴枷鎖之形，是災殃的「殃」的本字(丁山)。《說文》：「殃，咎也。」

中央(ちゅうおう): center, middle, central

甲金文從「 大 」或「 天 」(象人形正面)從◎，象人頸部戴枷鎖之形，是災殃的「 殃 」的本字(丁山)。《說文》：「殃，咎也。」 一說人戴枷鎖時頭在中央，故引申有中央之意(徐中舒)。高鴻縉則認為◎象扁擔之形，人挑擔時必站在扁擔中央，故有中央之意。《說文》：「央，中央也。从大在冂之内。大，人也。央旁同意。一曰久也。」 甲骨文用作人名。金文除用作人名外，還表示鮮明之貌。虢季子白盤：「彤矢其央」，《詩．小雅．六月》：「織文鳥章，白旆央央。」毛亨《傳》：「央央，鮮明貌。」 簡帛文字「 央 」通假作「 殃 」，《睡虎地秦簡．日書甲種》：「此皆不可殺，小殺小央(殃)，大殺大央(殃)。」《馬王堆漢帛書．老子乙本卷前古佚書》：「過極失當，天將降央(殃)。」《說文》：「殃，咎也。一曰禍也、罰也、敗也。」
Jia Jin inscription from " big" or " tian" (like a human figure on the front) from ◎, like a person wearing a shackle on the neck, is the original word for disaster (Ding Shan). "Shuowen": "Sorry, blame." It is said that when a person wears a shackle, his head is in the center, so the extension implies the center (Xu Zhongshu). Gao Hongjin believes that ◎ looks like a pole. People must stand in the middle of the pole when carrying a pole, so it means central. "Said Wen": "Yang, the central government. From the big to the inside. The big, the people. The Yang and the side agrees. It's a long time." Oracle is used as a person's name. In addition to being used as a person's name, the inscription also expresses a distinctive appearance. White Plate of Guo Jizi: "Tong Shi Qi Yang", "Poetry. Xiaoya. "June": "Weaving Bird Chapter, Bai Yang Yang Yang." Mao Heng "Biography": "Yang Yang, bright appearance." The script " Yang" in the silk and bamboo slips pretends to be " Hang", "Sleeping Tiger Land Qin Bamboo Slips. Japanese Book A Type": "None of this can be killed, Xiaoyang (殃), Dayang (殃)." "Mawangdui Han Silk Book. "Ancient Lost Book before the First Book of Lao Zi": "If you go wrong, the sky will fall to the center."

央字的基本解释

央
yāng
中心，正当中：中央。
恳求：央求。央告。
尽，完了：夜未央。

央字的汉语字典释义

[①]［yāng］
［《廣韻》於良切，平陽，影。］
(1)中心，中央。
(2)尽，完了。
(3)久远。
(4)请求；恳求。
(5)通“殃”。祸害。
(6)广貌。参见“央央”。
[②]［yīng］
［《集韻》於驚切，平庚，影。］
鲜明貌。参见“央2央”。

央字的英文翻译

◎ 央
center, end, entreat

央字的康熙字典解释

【丑集下】【大字部】　央； 康熙笔画：5； 页码：页249第05
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?於良切，音秧。中也。【詩·秦風】宛在水中央。【淮南子·天文訓】中央爲都。【地形訓】中央四達，風氣之所通，雨露之所會也。　又半也。【詩·小雅】夜如何其，夜未央。【上官儀詩】明月樓中夜未央。　又盡也。【漢武帝·李夫人賦】惜蕃華之未央。　又廣也。【司馬相如·長門賦】覽曲臺之央央。　又未央，漢宮名，在長安。　又於京切，音英。旗斿貌。【詩·小雅】旂旐央央。　又鮮明貌。【詩·小雅】白旆央央。　【說文】从大，在冂之內。【徐曰】从大，取其正中，會意。

央字的源字形

央字的起名意思

：央的本义是萌芽，引申指中心，正中间，恳求，完结。

Центральная
древесина
Если человек несет груз, плечи, конечно, находятся в среднем положении шеста, поэтому это слово используется для выражения значения «середина».
«Книга песен»: «Конец посреди воды».
«Ян» также означает «истощение».
«Книга песен»: «Е Вэйян».
к Ши Аньян
Ли Ян
yāng, yīng
I yāng гл.
1) просить; умолять
到处央人帮忙 повсюду просить о помощи
2) кончаться
夜未央 ночь ещё не кончилась
II yāng сущ.
1) * поселение в центре округи
2) центр, середина; срединный, посередине, на половине; на полдороге
央渎 центральный арык
III yīng прил.
пышный, цветущий

央

Значения

Центр, середина; глава

Мнемоника

  • Большой 大 человек в центре 中 походного шатра.

  • "Этот герой — центральная фигура в этом кино."
Radicals: 大, 冂  (big, head)
Meaning Mnemonic
If someone has a big head you have to try to focus on the center of it when you talk to them.
You don't want to get caught with your eyes wandering all over their big head. Stare right at the center of their face. Ah geez, their eyes are kinda far away from here. You can really only see their nose...
Reading Mnemonic
This is the center of the 王's (おう) head so you have to be extra careful not to look anywhere else.
The 王 will definitely cut off your normal-sized head if he sees you looking all over his big head and not at the center.
